resources.string: Your health and other people\'s health matters. Get tested when visiting certain social, cultural or sports events. Even when you\'ve already been vaccinated. Does your test prove you don\'t have coronavirus (negative test result)? Then you can get access.
Your QR code in your pocket
If your test proves you don\'t have coronavirus, you can make a personal QR code in this app. This will be your test declaration. The QR code is scanned before you get access.

Your QR code only states when you tested negative (no coronavirus), the time of testing, and the minimum amount of identifying data: your first name initial, your last name initial, your day of birth, and your month of both. We verify this information to make sure the test result is yours.
Validity of your negative test declaration

Want access to a certain social, cultural or sports event? Make sure your QR code is scanned at the entrance within %1$s hour(s) after the moment you\'ve been tested. When your negative test declaration expires, the QR code disappears from the app.
This is how the app uses your data
The privacy statement details how CoronaCheck handles your data. These are the most important points:
Your data is not centrally stored anywhere
Your GPS or location data is not used or saved
The QR code contains a minimum amount of personal data.
I\'ve read the privacy statement and give consent for processing my personal data.
To get access, have your QR code scanned at the entrance of an entertainment venue.
To get access to a pilot event, you need a negative test result. You can convert this into a QR code. Display your QR code and proof of identity at the entrance.
Show QR code at the entrance
Want to make a QR code? Get tested for coronavirus first.
Turn your negative test result into a personal QR code.
Does the test prove you don\'t have coronavirus? Then you can make a QR code out of the test result. Indicate where you were tested.
You need a retrieval code to retrieve your test result.

The test location gives you a retrieval code with numbers and letters.<br\><br\>Didn\'t get a code? Or did you lose it? Contact the test location.<br\><br\>It\'s possible you need to get tested again.
Enter your code. The test location sent it to you.
You get a code via text or email
This QR code isn\'t valid. Scan the QR code given to you by the test location.
Point your device at the QR code the test location gave you.
This test result is retrieved from the test location.<br\><br\>Is the below correct? Then you can convert the negative test result into a QR code. This is your test declaration.
Are you sure you want to stop?
You must use your code to get your test result again later.

Your test result states your test result, the time of testing, and a minimum amount of personal data.<br\><br\>Your details consist of: (1) the first letter of your first name, (2) the first letter of your last name, (3) your day of birth and (4) your month of birth.
Are these details different than the details on your identification card? Contact your test location. They can edit your details.
Your test result not yet known. Please try again later. Is this not correct? Contact the test location.
Your test result is now being made into a QR code
That you tested negative (no coronavirus) on February 2 at 14:06 will be processed into the QR code. The CoronaCheck app only shows the anonymous QR code, without test details.

Please try again later.

If you have any questions, contact your test location.

CoronaCheck is created so that people can visit social, cultural and sports locations again. With this app, visitors are able to prove they\'ve recently tested negative for corona. This way, the Netherlands can head out more often.
Your test result has already been retrieved and made into a QR code.<br\><br\> Is this not correct? Contact the test location.
Your QR code has expired.<br\>Get tested again.

You must get tested before you make a QR code. You can only turn a negative test result into a QR code.<br\><br\>A negative test declaration is valid until %1$s hour(s) after the moment you\'ve been tested. So schedule your test on time. And make sure your QR code is scanned at the entrance within %1$s hour(s).
CoronaCheck wants to access your camera
This is the only way the app can scan your QR code.
The app is no longer in use. For more information, go to CoronaCheck.nl
To continue, download the latest version of the app.
You\'re not connected to the internet
To start the app, you need to be connected to the internet.
Show QR code at the entrance
You can only use test results no older than %1$s hour(s) to make a QR code.
You can only use test results no older than %1$s hour(s) to make a QR code.
Your test result has been made into a QR code
That you\'ve been tested negative (no coronavirus) on %1$s at %2$s has been processed into the QR code. This app only shows the anonymous QR code, without any further test information.
This is where you can find an image of your QR code.
Information about your negative test result
You\'re not connected to the internet right now.

This has changed/b>
  • Initials and day and month of birth are included in the QR code
  • This data is displayed on the Scanner app for ID verification purposes
You can\'t proceed if you don\'t agree
You can\'t access the CoronaCheck app without agreeing to the updated terms.
The test location sends you a verification code via text or e-mail. Didn\'t get one? Then you can request a new code.
Enter your verification code to retrieve your negative test result.
Beware: your device is rooted. Your data may not be secure.
Over het maken van een QR-code

Je kan een QR-code maken van een negatieve testuitslag, een herstelverklaring of van een vaccinatie. Dat is jouw bewijs.

Meerdere bewijzen
Je kunt meerdere bewijzen tegelijkertijd hebben. Zowel een vaccinatiebewijs als een testbewijs, bijvoorbeeld. Ook kun je een bewijs voor je kinderen maken.

Ga je naar het buitenland?
Als je een QR-code maakt, krijg je automatisch een QR-code voor binnen Nederland en een die in Europa bruikbaar is. Gebruik in het buitenland de Europese QR-code.

Geldigheid in Europa
Weten welke test- en vaccinatiebewijzen geldig zijn in het land dat je bezoekt? Bekijk deze pagina. Zo voorkom je onverwachtse verrassingen ter plekke.
Waar wil je een QR-code van maken?
Je kan een QR-code maken van een negatieve testuitslag.
Uit de test blijkt dat ik geen corona heb
Ben je volledig gevaccineerd? Dan kun je een vaccinatiebewijs maken. Vragen over vaccinaties? Lees hier meer.
Je kan een QR-code maken van je vaccinaties. Dat is jouw bewijs.

Voor een Nederlandse QR-code worden er minimale gegevens opgehaald: je vaccinatiedatum en enkele gegevens van jou. Jouw gegevens bestaan uit de eerste letter van je voornaam, de eerste letter van je achternaam, je geboortedag en geboortemaand.

Jouw gegevens: %1$s %2$s %3$s %4$s
Weet je zeker dat je wilt stoppen?
Je moet dan later opnieuw met DigiD inloggen om je vaccinatie op te halen.
Kloppen jouw gegevens niet met je identiteitsbewijs? Neem contact op met je testlocatie om je gegevens te laten aanpassen.
